intro: Sugerokia, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Sugerokia has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, making it an important part of riparian ecosystems.
